resources.string: This sample demonstrates some advanced features of the Verint SDK. Follow the instructions below to check eligibility.

Page views criteria is the number of activities that the user must view in a single app session before they are eligible to be invited to participate in this measure’s survey. This count is reset when the app is put into the background. In this sample, the invite will be triggered after 3 page views.

Launch count criteria is the number of times the app is launched before the user is eligible for an invitation to participate in this measure’s survey. In this sample, the invite will be triggered after 5 launch counts. Please try to background/foreground the app 5 times.

This example demonstrates how you can implement an in-line custom invite in your app, and also use the default invite listener interface to be informed of any events involving the invitation and survey process. Please try to background/foreground the app 5 times.

Significant events are key-value pairs that define custom events for your app that cause an invitation for this measure to display. You are responsible for informing the SDK when the custom events occur through calls to the Core.incrementSignificantEventCountWithKey() method. In this sample, the invite is triggered by incrementing the significant event 3 times.
Once the invite is shown, the SDK drops into an idle state until the repeat days have elapsed. Use this button to reset the state of the SDK.
Can we send you a brief survey?
